title: HBL 2023 profit rises to a record Rs114bn, up 47%, with a focus on agriculture, digitally-led financial inclusion, sustainability
summary: Despite macroeconomic headwinds HBLs total advances increased to Rs 19 trillion over December 2022 with Consumer loans agriculture lending and microfinance all setting new benchmarks HBLs average balance sheet increased by an impressive Rs 700 billion while rising rates translated into a 159 bps improvement in net interest margin Fee growth was once again dominated by HBLs preeminent Cards business while trade cash management and retail banking all delivered more than 20 increases This year we have again introduced trailblazing products to shape Pakistans financial services landscape  Digital Invoicing an Urdu mobile app TalkBack for the visually impaired HBL has partnered with PSHA in a landmark opportunity to showcase one of Pakistans premier but undercelebrated sectors

title: HBL achieves record profit of Rs57.76bn in 2023, increases dividend payouts - Mettis Link News
summary: HBL achieves record profit of Rs5776bn in 2023 increases dividend payouts  Mettis Link News

title: HBL Power soars 8%, hits new high on healthy outlook; up 208% in 6 months
summary: Shares of HBL Power Systems hit a record high of Rs 30980 as they rallied 8 per cent on the BSE in Wednesdays intraday trade on healthy business outlook The stock of auto components  equipments company surpassed its previous high of Rs 29490 touched on August 24 2023In past six months the stock price of HBL Power has zoomed 208 per cent as compared to nearly 11 per cent rise in the SP BSE SensexThe principal activities of the HBL Power comprise of manufacturing of different types of batteries including lead acid nicad silver zinc

title: With A 26% Price Drop For HBL Power Systems Limited (NSE:HBLPOWER) You'll Still Get What You Pay For
summary: Although there are no analyst estimates available for HBL Power Systems take a look at this to see how the company stacks up on earnings revenue and cash flow HBL Power Systems PE ratio would be typical for a company thats expected to deliver very strong growth and importantly perform much better than the market Taking a look back first we see that the company grew earnings per share by an impressive 145 last year Weighing that recent mediumterm earnings trajectory against the broader markets oneyear forecast for expansion of 24 shows its noticeably more attractive on an annualised basis With this information we can see why HBL Power Systems is trading at such a high PE compared to the market

title: Israel-Hamas war: Bharat Forge, L&T, HBL Power other defence cos in focus. Here's why
summary: Nuvama Institutional Equities in its latest report said any escalation in IsraelHamas war may create opportunities for Indian players such as Bharat Forge Ltd Larsen  Toubro Ltd LT Tata Advanced Systems and Adani Group in the neartomedium term as Israel is likely to reach out to its allies such as India to ensure ample stockpiles for the war The brokerage said India currently exports Brahmos missiles artillery guns PINAKA rockets  launchers Dornier228 simulators armoured vehicles and radars The domestic brokerage said global demand for Indias localised products such as LCA Tejas LCH Prachand aircraft carriers and MRO activities are also growing Given the private sector accounts for 6070 per cent of Indias total defence exports we believe escalation of this ongoing IsraelHamas war may create opportunities for players such as Bharat Forge LT Tata Advanced Systems and Adani Group Also read Multibagger power stock headed for fresh 52week high hit 5 upper circuit in previous session

title: Pakistan's HBL CEO Aurangzeb resigns from bank, letter to bourse shows
summary: KARACHI Pakistan March 11 Reuters  Pakistans HBL President and CEO Muhammad Aurangzeb resigned from his position as leader of the countrys largest bank HBL said in a letter to the stock exchange shortly after Aurangzeb took an oath to join the government as a minister Sources said he was set to be Mr Muhammad Aurangzeb has tendered his resignation to the Board of Directors of Habib Bank Limited HBL and shall step down as President and Chief Executive Officer of HBL The Board of Directors of HBL has accepted his resignation subject to the approval of the State Bank of Pakistan read the notice The notice to the bourse added that Nassir Salim current chief operating officer of HBL has been appointed as president and CEO of the bank subject to approval from the regulator

title: We Think HBL Power Systems (NSE:HBLPOWER) Can Stay On Top Of Its Debt
summary: In the last three years HBL Power Systems basically broke even on a free cash flow basis But the stark truth is that we are concerned by its conversion of EBIT to free cash flow That means they are taking on a bit more risk in the hope of boosting shareholder returns When all is said and done sometimes its easier to focus on companies that dont even need debt Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest pricesensitive company announcements or qualitative material

title: Is Now The Time To Put HBL Power Systems (NSE:HBLPOWER) On Your Watchlist?
summary: But the reality is that when a company loses money each year for long enough its investors will usually take their share of those losses So it is good to see that HBL Power Systems insiders have a significant amount of capital invested in the stock That EPS growth certainly is attention grabbing and the large insider ownership only serves to further stoke our interest Although HBL Power Systems certainly looks good it may appeal to more investors if insiders were buying up shares Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest pricesensitive company announcements or qualitative material
